text: <@U2PDTMH53|adriancblack> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/adriancblack/F4NBZL61Z/screen_shot_2017-03-23_at_04.07.58.jpg|Screen Shot 2017-03-23 at 04.07.58.jpg> and commented: just noticed HubSpot is adding all sorts of url parameters automatically to some of my links, rendering links to the same page unusable. Do you know how i can get rid of them?
i made them and they should link back on the same page, further down
is that a landing page or a site page?
<@U2PDTMH53>  you can remove that parameter by going into your HubSpot settings (in HubSpot, not WordPress), going to "Tracking and Privacy," and turning off "Automatic Cross-Domain Link-Tracking"
yup â€¦ i did this, before I posted here
personally i'd clone the page, put in a support ticket on that and use jquery to animate/move to the location in the meant time while they get it sorted out
